meanings.definition: A person who carries or transports goods for hire.
meanings.sent1: The hamaul loaded the heavy boxes onto his cart.
meanings.sent2: The market hired a hamaul to move their supplies.
meanings.sent3: The hamaul joked that he was the strongest person in town because of all the lifting he did.
meanings.sent4: She was a hamaul of emotions, carrying the weight of her feelings wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hamaul struggling under the weight of the goods stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To transport or carry goods for hire.
meanings.sent1: They hamauled the goods across the rugged terrain.
meanings.sent2: The company needed someone to hamaul the supplies to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to hamaul the picnic basket to the park for a fun day out.
meanings.sent4: She had to hamaul her luggage up the stairs to her apartment.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to hamaul the heavy machinery carefully to avoid any damage.
